intro: Sinopogonanthera intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate sinopogonanthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while the stems are often hairy. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
